definition: old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)
to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive

sentences.english: "What is Hollywood culture?" Wen Xianglin saw Wen Xiang had become righteously indignant , and this so alarmed her that she was unsure what to do.
sentences.chinese: 文湘琳见文祥慷慨激昂的样子，吓得有点不知所措。

sentences.english: It is not a sign of humility to declaim against pride.
sentences.chinese: 慷慨激昂地攻击傲慢，并非谦逊的标志。

sentences.english: Taketo enforcement of such grip hammer Ji, zoned air-strike case, impassioned.
sentences.chinese: 武人执之如握锤戟，划空击案，慷慨激昂。

sentences.english: This is in the university hearing officer passionate strenuousness speech.
sentences.chinese: 这是中校在大学听证会上慷慨激昂的演讲。

sentences.english: A classmate gave an impassioned speech on the benefits of drinking liquor.
sentences.chinese: 一位同学对喝酒的好处做出了一次慷慨激昂的讲话。
他是个慷慨激昂的演说者。

sentences.english: A band march is accompanied to make the scence more memorable.
sentences.chinese: 同时还有乐队伴奏，令场面更加慷慨激昂。

sentences.english: Advocates of such regulatory measures are equally vehement.
sentences.chinese: 主张上述监管措施的倡导者同样慷慨激昂。

sentences.english: However, the impassioned singing did get through.
sentences.chinese: 然而，慷慨激昂的歌声也获得通过。

definition: devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
(of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
to speak forcibly out of a sense of righteousness (idiom)
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
